00029 #define DO_DEBUG false
00030 /*
00031  * LSystemNested class reads in a file containing a string 
00032  * an information on how to evolve that string, namely
00033  * probablities of change, and values and positions to chance.
00034  * Can also create it's own default string (11111111), and 
00035  * rules for Mutations
00036  * 
00037  * Mutation Probabilites for evolving are as follows:
00038  * The probabilities are held in a vector consists of a set of 4 pairs of integers, with each pair corresponding to th
00039  * with a key for each type listed below 
00040  * The pairs determine the evolution as follows:
00041  * the first entry is the probability (the entry * 0.0001 or the percent *.01)
00042  * that the second will have any
00043  * affect. The second entry affects it's corresponding entry in the system
00044  * like so:
00045  *
00046  * 1) The entry is swapped with one of it's neighbors
00047  *
00048  * Future:
00049  * the probability 
00050  * of the neighbor being picked decreasing with it's distance. (using gaussian
00051  * distribution)
00052  *
00053  * 2) The entry is toggled to one of the possible values for each entry, 
00054  * given by the user. 
00055  *
00056  * Future: a probablity may be given with each of the possible values made
00057  * available.
00058  *
00059  * 3) The entry is deleted.
00060  *
00061  * 4) The entry is doubled. (i.e., is inserted next to itself in the string).
00062  *
00063  * Options
00064  * Each option is one entry in the vector and is one word that may not contain commas
00065  *
00066  * Growth Rules
00067  * Similar to the options entry, except replacement happens in a deterministic fashion
00068  * (instead of the probabilistic replacement strategy employed by mutation
00069  * options). Currently the string is scanned every step, and each entry
00070  * checked for eligibility against all the production rules
00071  */
00072 class LSystemNested : public LSystem
00073 {
00074
